page.title: 18SCAYNES HILL GARAGE
page.content: In 1921 Mr JJE LUCKENS opened a garage in a World War 1 army hut behind the village Post Office on the South side of the main road. In 1926 he built a house in a field, on a pond, just to the North of the road, together with the new garage. JJEL bought the freehold of SCAYNES HILL HOUSE from Judge Grantham;the former tenant of the field, a builder, had retired. A Reading Room in the same field is now the village hall. JJL later employed one man and then two.On retirement of JJEL the garage was sold to a Mr Tom Parkin,then to a Mr Turner. Now it is called FIELDS,and the owner is Mr John Ashby. They sell petrol and are specialists in the fitment of tyres and exhaust systems; the garage is well sited on a busy road: the {A272}from Haywards Heath.
